item.title: Report E-2024040615
item.description:
Report E-2024040615

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: PLAQUEMINE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7502
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC trailer was at the shipper location and was loaded with Methoxy-2-propanol. The trailer skin began to trip product. Approximately 1 gallon was released. E3 Environmental responded to the scene and assisted with transferring the product into a another trailer and remediating the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024040198
item.description:
Report E-2024040198

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: NEW ORLEANS
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation Inc
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/2/2024, at 1624 hours, FRA Hazardous Materials Inspector L. Rawls, at the CSXT Gentilly Yard in New Orleans, LA discovered UTLX 130322, a residue tank car last contained: Zinc Chloride, with the fill port cover open. The car was isolated and the shipper, Micronutrients, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-04-02--00252). Specialized Professional Services, Inc. (SPSI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to assess and correct the reported issue. SPSI personnel inspected, closed and secured the fill port cover. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Keith Hughes at 317-494-0256). While no visible product release was noted, because this shipment was found open to the atmosphere, and per FRA guidance, it is presumed that some volume of hazardous material vapor or residue was released.

item.title: Report I-2024040028
item.description:
Report I-2024040028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 17:45hrs 3/12/2024, Southeastern Freight Lines employee attempted to load the Outbound shipment onto trailer 289184F located in dock door 35. While loading a protruding piece of wood punctured the 250 gallon tote of UN2922 product. This caused approximately 50 gallons of the product to spill in the Southeastern trailer & on the dock. The tote was maneuvered on its side immediately in efforts to stop the spillage. Containment boom, absorbent pad, & floor dry were used in additional efforts to contain the spill. None of the chemical was near or entered any type of drain system. Southeastern Freight Lines Safety was notified approximately at 17:50hrs. Hazmat 1 was notified approximately at 18:01 hrs. LA State Police & E3/OMI Environmental arrived approximately between 19:30 -20:00hrs. After accessing the situation at hand, E3/OMI Environmental proceeded to pump the waste chemical from the damaged tote into a new tote. They also cleaned & decontaminated the affected area. All clean up efforts concluded approximately at 02:00hrs. E3/OMI will coordinate the pick up of the following: 1-empty 250 gallon tote, 1-300 gallon tote, 4-55 gallon drums with clean up, 1-bag of contaminated pallets & packaging materials, & 1 bag w/ contaminated wooden crate.
